purpleculture_pinyin:
jiāo
to pour liquid; to irrigate (using waterwheel); to water; to cast (molten metal); to mold
залить жидкость; для полива (с помощью водяного колеса); к воде; лить (расплавленный металл); плесневеть
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 浇)
Pictophonetic: 堯 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:

澆灌 [ jiāo guàn ]: to water; to irrigate
澆注 [ jiāo zhù ]: to cast (metal)
澆鑄 [ jiāo zhù ]: to cast (molten metal); to mold
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 堯 [ yáo ] a legendary ancient emperor-sage
heisig_chinese_memo: The pigpen water comes in the form of a sprinkler.  If you use a bowl the pigs will push and shove and knock it over.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The javelin thrower practices really hard.  He takes a few sprinkles of water every now and again in between his constant launching.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " water " and " Yao ", the original meaning is to irrigate with water. "Said Wen": "𣵽 also. From the water, the sound of Yao." Tang Wangjian's "Original New Residence", the ninth: "Sweep the canal and worry about the bamboo and drought, water the land to induce orchids."

" Pouring " can mean showering or sprinkling. Southern Song Dynasty Liu Yiqing's "Shi Shuo Xin Yu-Ren Dan": "Ruan Ji has a big chest, so he must drink it with wine."

" Pouring " can specifically refer to wine being spilled on the ground as a memorial service. Tang Li Bai "Dongshan Yin": "After the white chicken dream was three hundred years old, he sprinkled wine and poured his love on the same."

" Pouring " also means thin and not thick, and it also means thinness, which refers to a bad social atmosphere. Song Luyou "Tai Koo": "There is no need to be blamed as a book contract. The customs have been poured in when the rope is first tied."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " water " and " Yao ", the original meaning is to irrigate with water.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「堯」聲，本義為以水灌溉。《說文》：「𣵽也。从水，堯聲。」 唐王建〈原上新居〉之九：「掃渠憂竹旱，澆地引蘭生。」

　　「澆」可表示淋、灑。南朝宋劉義慶《世說新語‧任誕》：「阮籍胸中壘塊，故須酒澆之。」

　　「澆」可特指酒灑於地，以示祭奠。唐李白〈東山吟〉：「白雞夢後三百歲，灑酒澆君同所懽。」

　　「澆」也表示薄、不厚，亦表示浮薄，指社會風氣不好。宋陸游〈太古〉：「不須追咎為書契，初結繩時俗已澆。」
humanum_short_description: 從「水」，「堯」聲，本義為以水灌溉。

(Simplified: 浇)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 堯 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
HSK: 5
Chinese: The pigpen water comes in the form of a sprinkler. If you use a bowl the pigs will push and shove and knock it over.
Meaning: sprinkle
Hanzi: 浇
Story: The javelin thrower practices really hard. He takes a few sprinkles of water every now and again in between his constant launching.
Kind: traditional

從「 水 」，「 堯 」聲，本義為以水灌溉。《說文》：「𣵽也。从水，堯聲。」 唐王建〈原上新居〉之九：「掃渠憂竹旱，澆地引蘭生。」 「 澆 」可表示淋、灑。南朝宋劉義慶《世說新語‧任誕》：「阮籍胸中壘塊，故須酒澆之。」 「 澆 」可特指酒灑於地，以示祭奠。唐李白〈東山吟〉：「白雞夢後三百歲，灑酒澆君同所懽。」 「 澆 」也表示薄、不厚，亦表示浮薄，指社會風氣不好。宋陸游〈太古〉：「不須追咎為書契，初結繩時俗已澆。」
From the sound of " water" and " Yao", the original meaning is to irrigate with water. "Said Wen": "𣵽 also. From the water, the sound of Yao." Tang Wangjian's "Original New Residence", the ninth: "Sweep the canal and worry about the bamboo and drought, water the land to induce orchids." " Pouring" can mean showering or sprinkling. Southern Song Dynasty Liu Yiqing's "Shi Shuo Xin Yu-Ren Dan": "Ruan Ji has a big chest, so he must drink it with wine." " Pouring" can specifically refer to wine being spilled on the ground as a memorial service. Tang Li Bai "Dongshan Yin": "After the white chicken dream was three hundred years old, he sprinkled wine and poured his love on the same." " Pouring" also means thin and not thick, and it also means thinness, which refers to a bad social atmosphere. Song Luyou "Tai Koo": "There is no need to be blamed as a book contract. The customs have been poured in when the rope is first tied."

澆字的基本解释

澆
jiāo
见“浇”。

澆字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jiāo］
［《廣韻》古堯切，平蕭，見。］
“浇1”的繁体字。
(1)以水灌溉。
(2)淋；洒。
(3)酒洒于地，以示祭奠。
(4)浇铸。将金属溶液注入模型以凝固成形的一种工艺。
(5)薄，不厚。参见“澆薄”。亦谓浮薄。指社会风气不好。
(6)姓。明有浇彧。见《续通志·氏族六》。
[②]［nào］
［《集韻》女教切，去效，娘。］
“浇2”的繁体字。
(1)急流回旋貌。
(2)指湍流扬起波浪。
(3)通“撓”。参见“澆2滑”。
[③]［ào］
［《廣韻》五弔切，去嘯，疑。］
“浇3”的繁体字。
人名。即过浇。传说为夏代寒浞之子。
[④]［xiāo］
“浇4”的繁体字。
方言。湖南长沙等地呼布帛薄而不坚为浇。

澆字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　澆； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页651第27
【唐韻】古堯切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】堅堯切，?音驍。【說文】?也。一曰薄也。【後漢·循吏傳】澆淳散樸。　又姓。明總兵澆彧。　又【集韻】【類篇】?力交切，音聊。水洄洑貌。【王逸楚辭註】回波爲澆。　又【廣韻】【韻會】五弔切【集韻】倪弔切，?音顤。人名。寒浞子。　又【集韻】魚到切，音傲。義同。或作?。

Pour
jiāo

Pour
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jiāo］
["Guangyun" Gu Yaoqi, Pingxiao, see. ]
Traditional characters for "Pour 1".
(1) Irrigate with water.
(2) Sprinkle; sprinkle.
(3) Sprinkle wine on the ground as a memorial service.
(4) Casting. A process in which metal solution is injected into a mold to solidify and shape.
(5) Thin, not thick. See "pouring thin". Also called floating and thin. Refers to the bad social atmosphere.
(6) Last name. Ming Yu Yu. See "Continued History · Clan Six".
[②]［nào］
["Jiyun" female teaches cutting, to effect, mother. ]
Traditional characters for "Pour 2".
(1) The swirling appearance of the jet stream.
(2) Refers to the turbulence that raises waves.
(3) Through "torsion". See "Pouring 2 Sliding".
[③] [ào]
["Guang Yun" five hanging cuts, go to whistle, doubt. ]
Traditional characters for "Pour 3".
Person's name. That is over poured. Legend is the son of Hanjun in the Xia Dynasty.
[④] [xiāo]
Traditional characters for "Pour 4".
dialect. In Changsha, Hunan and other places, the cloth is thin but not firm.
